column1: S.A. De Smith’s, ‘Judicial Review’ 8th Edition, (at p. 999) notes:
“It has long been held to be preferable for the claimant to be able to show that he has
demanded performance of the duty and that performance has been refused by the authority
obliged  to  discharge  it.  A  claimant,  before  applying  for  judicial  review,  should  address  a
distinct and specific demand or request to the defendant that he perform the duty imposed
